data.title: James Cronin
data.meta_description: It was James Cronin’s quiet stubbornness that helped him to upturn one of the great cornerstone principles of physics, a finding that ultimately explained why the planets, stars and galaxies were able
data.text:
It was James Cronin’s quiet stubbornness that helped him to upturn one of the great cornerstone principles of physics, a finding that ultimately explained why the planets, stars and galaxies were able to evolve from the big bang birth of the Universe 13.7 billion years ago.

One of the three principles of symmetry in nature stated that the laws of physics were exactly alike for both ordinary matter and its opposing doppelgänger, known as antimatter — the sub-atomic particles that have the same mass but hold opposite and equal positive or negative charges to matter. Physicists had assumed for a long time that there was a kind of “mirror universe” where right and left were reversed and matter was replaced by antimatter, but in which
